author: sky.cactus
content: This is a tragedy of the commons problem.  Only one person needs to foot the bill to secure the system, and if everyone assumes someone else is doing it then you can get into a situation where no one is doing it.

author: sky.cactus

author: sky.cactus
content: I think part of the reason these things calling themselves L2s don't have actual security is partly because it is actually really hard to build correctly.

author: sky.cactus
content: The power, IMO, is sourced from the government and its exclusive right to use force.  The wealthy just leverage that to get ahead.  If we stop the wealthy (somehow) from leveraging that power, the power will still exist and still be exploited by those who seek to get ahead.  At best we can do what Russia or China did and change the demographic who seizes that power from wealthy people to politicians or the military or whatever.

author: sky.cactus
content: If, instead, we take the power away entirely, then there is nothing left to exploit by anyone.
